name: barbara brown
text: This facility is incapable and lacks knowledge of imagining patients who have pacemakers compatible with MRI. They were all over the place in giving the reasons they could not see these type of patients which were inaccurate, eg., "Pacemaker has to be shut off "which is the wrong terminology on how patients with this compatible device are managed. This place is behind the times in comprehensive imaging.

resp.text:
MRI centers accepting patients with MR-conditional implantable cardiac rhythm devices should refer to the SureScan Patient Scanning Process to find instructions for determining whether a patient with a Medtronic SureScan System meets the criteria to receive an MRI, as well as instructions to follow before, during, and after an MRI scan.

As indicated from the Medtronic web site, pacemakers and defibrillators are MRI CONDITIONAL, meaning all conditions must be met to perform the scan.  To safely scan a patient with one of these devices, proper monitoring must be performed during the exam, i.e. pulse oximetry or electrocardiography.  Please see below taken directly from their web site.  As you may notice, it is also required to have a defibrillator nearby when scanning patients with these devices.

Pacemaker and CRT-P Requirements: Proper patient monitoring*must be provided during the MRI scan.  An external defibrillator must be available nearby during the MRI procedure.
ICD and CRT-C Requirements: Proper patient monitoring*must be provided the entire time SureScan is programmed to On.  An external defibrillator must be immediately available the entire time MRI SureScan is programmed to On.
*This includes visual and verbal contact with the patient and monitoring heart rate using instrumentation such as pulse oximetry or electrocardiography.

As an out-patient facility, we are not equipped to provide the level of monitoring required to perform MRI on patients with these devices.  This should give added comfort to prospective patients that we are considering all safety aspects of the exam rather than seeking to do all exams no matter the risk, just for financial gain.

name: Chance Cristwell
text: Guy who bought the place actually ripped off the original owner, Suzanne Cristwell, who built the company, and paid her one installment of what was supposed to a multiple year contract. She's still trying to get it into court. Great quality equipment, especially considering the guy got it for next to nothing.

name: Del Chick
text: Closed MRI went great ! Had MRI on my lower back, only took 15 min. I went in feet first (thank goodness!) They gave me earplugs plus headphones to soften that horrific noise (it helped a lot). I also had Xanax. Put some pillows under me so I was comfy.  Had to keep eyes closed but at least my head was partially out. My arms were over my head on pillow holding my panic button, never used it.  Late in day seemed like better timeframe.  (At another place, they did this all wrong and I had instant panic attack, so I walked out!). This place is MUCH better.

name: Peggy Chestnut
text: Staff was very kind, punctual, and professional. I had a stress test performed within 24 hours of my physician's order. During the procedure every aspect was thoughly explained and monitored by the technician, and overseen by the doctor. I would definitely return for future services if needed, and will certainly recommend I M I.

name: andrew moreland
text: My brother had an appointment this past Tuesday at 2pm.  He was scheduled for a MRI.  When it was his turn we entered the room and she mentioned that his neck back and brain were being tested. I assisted the tech in getting my brother positioned on the table.  She put some type of head gear on him and she was having alot of trouble getting it on.  She kept trying to close it but it wouldn't close I thought it was too small but I wasn't sure she did finally get it closed (sidenote the headgear caused brusing under his chin).    Neither one of us had any idea on what was going to happen with this procedure.  She started the machine my brother nor I was told how long this procedure would take.   About an hour and a half went by we heard a banging in the room.  My brother was banging on the inside of the machine and yelling.  She pulls him out he is sweating profusely and he is shaking uncontrollably.  My brother is now refusing to finish the procedure.  We got him put back in his wheelchair he was crying uncontrollably as we left the clinic.  I'm not sure what happened in the MRI machine  to my brother but I would suggest that patients be told a little about the procedure and definitely how long the procedure will take.

I would not have any problems being referred again.  I gave them 4 out of 5 stars, because there is always room for improvement.

text: If I could I wouldnt give even one star! It was an awful experience. The mri tech was cold, rude and without ability, I guess, to even give a half-smile. But the worst part is that I was stuck SIX TIMES before my contrast IV was started. The first, rudest, tech stuck me twice then called in someone else who finally got it on the FOURTH try. Yes that makes SIX attempts. But she tried to get me to just stop and call it finished without the contrast on her second (4th total) attempt. I told her no, that I wanted to get the complete test that my doctor ordered. She said she could probably put the iv in the underside of my wrist but that it would “hurt real bad”. I asked her to please try my thumb first, which she did and finally got it. Not one apology from either tech about having to stick me so many times. They did not care at all that they were hurting me, just that it was taking so long. This was unacceptable to say the least. When they finally finished the test, I had been in that one position so long that I couldnt get up. The tech gave me a disapproving look and just stood there frowning till I finally got up. I had trouble walking for some time after this debacle. Horrible place! I will do anything I  can to avoid ever going there again.

name: Rebekka Sharpe
text: Friendly staff, comfortable environment, but SCAMMY! I paid a large copay about three weeks ago to get an MRI and still know nothing. They "sent it off to Birmingham" to be read where the results would then be sent to my doctor, but my doctor has heard nothing. First of all if you have a state of the art MRI facility in Decatur Alabama why can you not have someone in Decatur Alabama read the results? Secondly if the results cannot be read at the facility then why Birmingham? There are plenty of places in the area that have someone in house to read your MRI, or at least get the results back to you in a day or three.

resp.text: Good Morning, Rebekka Sharpe.  The results of your MRI were sent to your referring physician on 11/15/17 in under 24 hours. We have the fax confirmation on file of when and where it was sent.  Your referring physician is whom you need to speak with about those results. If you are having trouble still, please call us at 256-350-7779.  Just let us know! We will be happy to send the results again to your referring physician if they need us to. We partner with a group of Radiologists to read our scans out of Birmingham. This helps to provide accurate reads in a timely manner (24 hour results). I hope this information helps.  Have a great day and we wish you a Happy New Year.

name: 2k tips
text: So sitting in the waiting room of St. Vincent’s Blount waiting on my appointment. All of a sudden the receptionist, patients and staff are running screaming at me to run down the hall. They scream over the intercom code silver. I get up and start going down the hall. The first waiting room I came to was x-ray. The staff inside locks the door and I’m tapping on the window to find out what’s going on. Just so happens I know one of the woman working there. A gentleman asks her if she knows me and she replies yes. They slip me a note through the door telling me to call them in 15 minutes. I hear a woman inside say get forceful and tell him to leave. I turn to look down the hall and every soul is gone except for me and the man who stole a gun out of a car in the parking lot. I had no idea where he was. No one would help me or tell me what was going on. I was locked out in the hallway that is at least 80 yards long by myself with no means to defend myself. The man was obviously sick and out of his mind. I saw him when I pulled up and he gave me an uneasy feeling. I was not scared for me but thought to myself what if an elderly/young woman or a child walked in the door behind him what would they do. The only thing I could think to use to defend my self was a chair that was sitting in the radiology waiting area. I said to myself he will probably shoot me but hopefully I can beat him enough with the chair that he couldn’t hurt anyone else. I was starring down the hall waiting for him to walk/run towards me and I was going to do my best to stop him with a chair. Another thought I had was if I had my gun on me I would at least be in a better position to defend myself. Luckily the police got there and disarmed the man. I was so mad at the hospital staff for telling me to run down the hall and then locking me out of EVERYTHING. I was nothing more than a target at that point. I could understand their policy a little better if I hadn’t been waiting for 45 minutes in the same chair they ask me to flee from while rushing other patients into offices to protect them from a possibility bad outcome. I asked the Administrator what was the big plan for me. Wait till he shoots me then scurry on over to the E.R. All he said was this is not supposed to happen here. Needless to say I am extremely, extremely disappointed in the way St. Vincent’s Blount handled things today!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Complete negligence for patient care!

name: Kandi Warnock
text: I have had a bad experience with Dr Little every time I have been seen by him. He has horrible bedside manner , seems like he does not want to be there and you are wasting his time. I was sent by home health  care for fluids due to dehydration from Dysautonomia, he proceed to say here drink Gatorade , I politely told him I am allergic and he still insisted it was what I needed. I have Dysautonomia and require IV fluids , if Gatorade and water worked I would not be coming to the ER. It is a well  known fact that in the area,  he is a horrible doctor, most call friends to see if he is on call and avoid to go if he is there. I can say being an Army for many years , seen dozens of doctor’s he is the absolute worse I ever encountered. You have a 50 percent chance of getting a good nurse.

resp.text: Hi, we always appreciate the opportunity to improve, and we’d like to talk to you more about how we can do this. Please reach out to us at 205-930-2333 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm) when you have a moment, so we may discuss your review. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Lynn Wray Dillard (Alabama Creeks)
text: Family member admitted for extended stay for rehabilitation due to repair of broken hip. I spend 5 days here helping care for her. I am so impressed with the kindness, compassion and all around professionalism of the staff. The sweet folks that cleaned the room did excellent work. The dietary staff staff were so quick to bring a different item if we asked for it. The meals provided were well prepared and delivered with a smile. The RNs were precious: Madison, Haley, & Hazel showed pure loving care and were so patience even when we seems to be pressing that “call button” every 5 minutes. The case manager went above and beyond to keeps us informed about what needs we might have in the future. There is an obvious Godly spirit guiding the workers and medical staff here at St. Vincent’s Blount. I will never forget the kindness and love shown to my family. And they have free wi-fi.

resp.text: Hello Lynn Wray Dillard. Our hospital aims to deliver the highest quality patient care. We love to hear about these positive experiences. Thanks for sharing this feedback with us!

name: Amber Allen
text: I would not suggest this hospice company to anyone who cares about the terminally ill patient. Our nurse hasn’t answered our phone calls on the first call yet. Thankfully my father was only on hospice 5 days before passing on. The morning he passed, we couldn’t even get someone to answer the “emergency” number. I got in touch with an operator and she transferred me to another extension, who  didn’t answer either. My father passed at 9:30am on a Thursday, so anyone who has a loved one pass at an odd time of day my heart breaks for you because you will be looking at your deceased loved one for an extended amount of time. Once my father passed (at a rather young age) naturally my mom wanted the hospice bed out of her living room. On day two after his passing, we called frequently throughout the day about the equipment being picked up, after being assured it would be. At 6:30pm on day two, my husband called again to ask when the equipment would be gone and the lady said not today and hung up on my husband after he explained to her the equipment would now be outside for them. This is not the kind of experience you want when losing your father.

name: Laura T
text: Wish I could give 0 stars. The staff is very rude and quick to judge. They screwed up on me multiple times where I nearly lost my life and family members as well that have been there. If you want your life saved DO NOT go here. They deserve to be shut down. Maybe that will happen one day.

resp.text: We try very hard to meet expectations and we regret that we have not done so in this case, Pandi Bear. Please email us HospitalReviews@Ascension.org so we can address your concerns.

text: The service has been great for my mom. Rated a three for the quality of the food in cafeteria and how expensive it is for food. Having to pay full price for three meals a day gets expensive. They didn’t run a flu test, they pretty much laughed at me and told me to take some ibuprofen and sent me home. So I knew I had the flu and decided to go to boaz Er where what do you know, I was burning up and I have the flu.

I’d seriously hate for anyone deathly sick to have to go to Oneonta emergency room because they would just laugh at you and send you home to die.

Sorry but if you can’t thoroughly check out your patients and give them correct treatment you do NOT need to be a nurse or doctor. I wish I knew how to call and properly complain on them.

text:
I had two  heart tests scheduled with the Birmingham Heart Clinic at St. Vincent's Blount as well as a stress test to be done at St. Vincent's Blount on April 29th.
I reported to BHC for the two heart tests and was told the tech who did the tests was not available that day for some reason.  I came back to the hospital later that morning for my stress test.  Heidi did the stress test.  She learned that I had been unable to complete the other tests by the BHC tech that morning.  She said that the hospital had had a cancellation that day and asked me if I wanted the hospital tech to do my tests to save me another trip.  I agree and she called and set up the other tests for me and they were completed in a timely manner.  I wish to commend Heidi for the  way that she handled my stress test and also for going the extra mile to get my other tests handled the same day.

text: I needed to have a mammogram and screening breast ultrasound because I have been told I have dense breasts.  They scheduled me right away.  I spent hardly any time at check in. It is nice to have a separate, private area from the rest of the center.  I felt so relaxed for they entire visit.  Stacy did such a great job on the mammogram and Jordan did an excellent job on my US.  I got a letter with the results with 2 days!  Wow!  I will always return here for not only my mammograms but also if I ever need an MRI, x-ray, CT, etc for me or my whole family.  Nice change of pace in the medical world to have such great professional service!

I came by and the person in front of me had extensive tests and it would be at least 2 hours before they got to me.  Understandable - said I would be back on my lunch break on Monday.  Again, was assured - this time by the check-in desk clerk - that daytimes were typically not busy and I probably would be in and out fast.  I have been here an hour and a half, after being told as I came in the wait would be about 15 minutes.  They do great work here, but I am very frustrated and unhappy with the wait time ...

name: Emily Kunkler
text:
We visited this wonderful hospital from out of town tonight as we were passing through to go to Florida for our vacation. My almost 4 year old was having an allergic reaction to something he shouldn’t have eaten and I have nothing but great things to say. We were greeted with a smile from the person checking patients temps at the door. Walked directly to the desk to get checked in and met another smiling face. Next the nurse doing vitals was very nice and friendly.  Our nurse Aida was SOOO sweet to my little boy and even gave him two prizes for being so good. He was so excited to give it to his brother when he got back to the hotel. (Reminded me of the old days when I went to the ER 25 years ago and got a stuffed animal that I still have to this day.) Dr. Gore was in the room before I even had time to sit down and was very kind, reassuring, and professional as well! Our little boy was okay too. Given some Benadryl and we were back to the hotel within an hour of leaving.

This experience was a great example of what people and hospitals should be like! Thank you!!!!

name: Ann McAnnally
text: I will not be seeing Dr. Kissel again. Worse 'patient/dr. manners I have encountered' I have been having excruciating pain in left knee, sleepless nights and misery for about 3 weeks. He was highly recommended, upon arrival they made one front board x-ray of knee after I told them explicitly it was the right inside of left knee. I am a very healthy 84 yr old, just had raving reports from primary Dr. this week on my lab work, agility and very active lifestyle. Dr. Kissels words to me were that's an old 80 year old knee, some arthritis. Take tylenol and get an otc cream. I asked if it could be a torn miniscus he said probably but that knee is old with a lot of miles. No mention of mri or further ckg into it. I could walk 2-5 miles with no limp before this onset, don't take pain pills, have not been admitted to any hospital since 1976 ,clean my own gutters, horseback ride etc. He repeatedly referred to my old knee. Well I plan to use these 'old knees' for several more years to play t ball and dollhouse in the floor with my great grands. Needless to say I cancelled my appt. to go back in two weeks, I heard him loud and clear about my old knees.  Love St. Vincent's Hospital this is totally about the one doctor.

name: Rosalie Pearson
text:
My mom lives in nearby Thorsby while I live in Montgomery. She called me at 11:30pm to say she felt lightheaded, a little dizzy, and had what felt like a slight pressure in her chest. She called the ambulance and the EMT's took her to St. Vincent's to be checked out.

I had left Montgomery immediately after receiving the call and arrived at the hospital minutes after her ambulance had arrived (the EMT's were just bringing out the gurney to their rig when I got there) I went into the Emergency Room, told them why I was there and gave them info on my mom (name, date of birth, address, phone, and reason for admittance). The woman told me they were going to get her in a room and then ask when I could come back. I was the ONLY person in the waiting room. About 20 minutes later she said again that they had her in a room and would see when I could go back. Fifteen minutes after that she said a woman had just gone back to see if I could go back. Needless to say it was over an hour before they let me go back. The worst part is that I had assumed they would at least let my mom know I was there. Even though she had been asking them and voicing concerns about how I had not yet arrived no one from the waiting room told her I was there and none of the nurses back with my mom bothered to check if I had arrived. This was not a far walk either, considering my mom was approx. 30 ft inside the doors from the waiting room I was in.

When I finally did get back to see her she was hooked up to a heart and pulse/ox monitor and they had a fluid IV in. They took her out to get chest X-rays and a CT scan minutes after I got back there. When she returned to the room about 15 minutes later, the nurse that brought her back first said she didn't know how to hook my mom back up to the machine and the IV...then was going to try...then decided no, she would have someone come in and do it. A half hour went by and no one came in to hook her back up. I stepped outside the door and explained that she had not been hooked back up and the nurse at the station said thanks, and they would come in and do it...which they never did. The original doctor she saw was also standing there when I told the nurse and did nothing. You would think if you were monitoring someone who you think may have had a heart attack you would want them hooked up to a monitor.

Finally, the doctor came in a little before 4am and said that the X-rays, and CT scan were just fine, but there were concerns with her blood work (PS no one had ever come in to hook my mom back up to the monitors). The doctor explained there are three types of cardiac enzymes. One that tells if there is actual muscle damage and that they use to determine if you've had a heart attack (which was normal and my mom did not), and two others. One of the extra two was normal and then the doctor said that the third was "significantly higher." She said that could indicate that although she may not have had a heart attack that enzyme could mean there could be something brewing or big That could happen on the horizon. She wanted to admit my mom so she could see the cardiologist in the morning...which we did. Kicker is when the cardiologist came in and looked at the tests he said it was slightly elevated, but nothing that he found alarming.

All in all I just felt like even though the ER was extremely slow, and at times there were 4 or more staff members sitting at the desk area within the ER, the overnight crew seemed fairly insufficient at simple things, like communicating that family members are there, or rehooking a patient back up to monitors and IV's.

text: I had a great experience at this location. I came in with a last-minute referral from a local Urgent Care. They were able to get me in within 30 minutes for an ultrasound. The ultrasonographer was polite, accommodating, and easy to talk to. I had a great time. They were then able to have their doctor evaluate my images, contact my primary doctor, discuss the images with her, and get back to me within 15 minutes while I waited in the lobby. It was determined I would need an MRI for further diagnostics and they got me in last-minute (again) within 20 minutes. At this point, the ultrasonographer came out to the lobby and offered me a coffee for my wait. Between the friendliness, punctuality, and consideration, this place deserve nothing less than a 5-star rating. For extra information, the facility itself is clean, open, well-lit, and offers plenty of comfortable seating along with restrooms and access to a water-fountain. I'm considering injuring myself again just so I can come back and  have this experience a second time - but that hinges on how much my insurance is able to cover.

name: LaSheena Fields
text: Went for my 38 week ultrasound and left there with only a photo of my son’s hand. Will need to contact my insurance because I was charged a $40 copay at which my insurance covers. The imaging was absolutely horrible, I just pray my sons results are accurate.

resp.text: Hello LaSheena, I hope that everything is going well with you and your baby! It was great to speak with you so long ago about your review. As we discussed, it is often quite difficult to obtain great ultrasound pictures of a baby at 38 weeks. Sometimes the baby is faced head down and is not as "cooperative" for pictures as he is earlier on in a pregnancy. We also discussed that visualization is limited at this stage because the ratio of amniotic fluid to the amount of baby is small. Fluid assists the  ultrasound technologist to see the baby's body parts more clearly. The ratio is better earlier on in the pregnancy during the time when we typically do the full anatomy scan (18-22 weeks). Later in the pregnancy (38-42 weeks) the doctors are looking at fetal movement, heart rate, amniotic fluid amount, and fetal presentation to determine the safety of a vaginal delivery. Although great pictures are difficult to obtain at this stage, the information they need to assess those items can be obtained. Thanks again for allowing me to discuss this with you. We do love our patients and we want you to know we will always strive to give you the best care and the greatest level of satisfaction with our services.

name: Doreen Kostelac
text:
Can not even begin to tell you how dissappointed I am with my experience at the Auburn location.
1)  The operator set up my appointment with their other location in error.
2)  Both restrooms were not clean.  There was no paper towels in one and the other had an overflowing wastebasket.  I brought it to the receptionist's attention and nothing was done about it.
3) They mandated that I pay my co-pay for an office visit.  I explained this isn't an office visit it is for  testing and I am not required to pay a co-pay, but they demanded it anyway.  I have received my explaination of benefits from my insurance and a co-pay was not due.  When I called they said they would send out the refund.  They showed a credit balance on my account but I never received a credit statement.  Hmmm.  (This review is 4 months post visit).
4)  NOW THE BIGGEST PROBLEM....I previously had kidney cancer and have had to have follow up CT scans due to my condition.  The radiologist stated  it appears that my kidney cancer is not only back but he couldn't rule out that it had spread to my liver.  This news was very concerning as you would imagine.  When I had my follow up appointment with my Oncologist, he did not like the very brief unprofessional report and suggested that he have my ct scan reviewed by the radiology team at my hospital as a second opinion.  Come to find out, my cancer was not back nor had it spread to my liver.  The radiologist must have mistaken scar tissue from my previous procedures as cancer.  Needless to say.  The 3 weeks prior to the 2nd opinion on my CT scan was not pleasant as I was preparing for metastisized kidney cancer.

PLEASE HEED THIS WARNING AND GO ELSEWHERE FOR YOU MEDICAL NEEDS!!!

text: I had been to Bridgeway  Diagnostics  i Phenix City  Al. I told him my Daughter Victoria Elizabeth ( Tori Beth) Thomps ame to you last week and Loved it as much as I did when I wenr to Phenix City ! Please get some moe PR out there ,I promise I am doing my best  to let Eberyone know !  So Happy  Ya'll are here  and WELCOME   !  THANKS  A MILLION  ! JILL TURNER  PS the  YOUNG LADIES at the Front DESK  AND TABITHA  WERE EXCEPTIONALY  EXCELLENT  !

resp.text: So happy you came to us Jill!  Many people don't realize it but all you have to do is ask your physician to send you to Bridgeway in Phenix City or Auburn.  Both locations, as you know, are quite easy to access and we strive to make you as comfortable as possible during every visit.  Both you and your physician will be happy you requested us. We really appreciate you and we are so grateful for patients like you who do the best kind of advertising for us! By the way, if you or any of your family or friends are due for a mammogram, you can request Bridgeway for that too. We are the only provider in the Auburn/Opelika area to offer 3D breast tomography (lowest dose 3D mammogram), and also the only provider in the area to offer 3D Automated Breast Ultrasound (an additional screening tool for women with dense breast tissue). Both of these are available in Auburn and Phenix City. Most people (myself included) will tell you it is the most comfortable mammogram they have ever had! We can get prior exam results from any facility.  Thanks again for your review Jill!

name: Mike Brooks
text: Bridgeway is great.

resp.text: We agree! Thanks for sharing!

name: Niconico nii
text:
Tried calling to set up a payment plan for a bill. Told employee I don’t have good service and asked if I could set it up over the phone.

Person proceeded to tell me to go online AFTER I told her that. 😤
She didn’t want to help me AT ALL.

All she wanted was a payment but didn’t want to do the extra leg work to actually help me.
She told me it would be $25.00 today and I could call back to pay again.

When I tried to get her to do said payment plan, she really wasn’t trying to do anything with me. It seemed like she was confused and wanted the full balance to stay how it was.

Never ever calling to set up another payment plan with them EVER again.

name: Cassie Thompson
text: Several months ago I had to go for my yearly mammogram and the receptionist Hannah was a true divine. She was so kind and so caring. Her personality was amazing. Today 11/18/20 I had to go to get an ultrasound for DVT and my technician was Kylie and she was just amazing. She was very caring and encouraging. Thank you Radiology Clinic for two amazing employees.

name: eleanor blackburn
text: I had an MRI appointment on Wed, March 24th at 9:30. When I came to check in, the receptionist was very rude saying, "you're late" and that the appt was at 9:00. I told her that I'm not late & that my appt was for 9:30. She had a very nasty attitude & kept telling me that it was at 9:00 & that I should reschedule for another day. I decided to wait because I wasn't going to reschedule when I wasn't late in the first place. An hour or so goes by, patients AFTER me  are being seen. Finally, someone comes and brings me to the back, I sat in a hallway a little while, the lady (I don't remember her name) was very nice to me and told me as soon as there was an available room, that I would be seen. She was told that I was late and that's why I was waiting for so long. I showed her my appointment paper, and in fact it said 9:30. She apologized. That rude receptionist never apologized.

name: PATRICIA BARR
text: Everyone was very friendly and professional. The doctor performing my test was really nice and I felt safe in his hands. I had a gall bladder test which required an IV for a radioactive fluid. It took an hour and a half (it could take a much as 4 hours) and I slept through it. Didn't have to wait long got my appointment either. I've had other appointments there and had the same courteous treatment.

name: Shelley Wood
text: Crystal in Medical Records is very polite and has the best customer service skills.   She went above and beyond to help.  I highly recommend The Radiology Clinic!

name: Lisa Savage
text: I came for my first mammogram and was very anxious. Heather was awesome! She explained exactly how everything was going to go, and helped calm my nerves. It was not bad at all. We need more people like Heather in the world!! 😊

name: Theresa Johnson (Terri)
text: Great people..

name: Natalie Strother
text: Husband waited over a hour to get a X-RAY and when was asked what took so long the receptionists was very sarcastic. Never had this problem before!!!!

name: Jeff Colvin
text: I was in and out in no time at all. Staff was friendly and welcoming.

name: Bridget Riley
text: "Everyone was very friendly, polite and professional. Everything was clearly explained and I felt reassured. The environment was very clean and presentable as well. I would recommend The Radiology Clinic."

name: Dan Birnstein
text:
They got me in, late afternoon with no appointment.
(I was half an hour before closing time).
When my X-ray were completed, they called my physician right away, again, around closing time!
I wish everybody would be as courteous and professional!

name: Kat A
text: I rarely give 5 but the staff was frkendly, clean, aost no wait.

name: Jeff Singer
text: Excellent.  Friendly and efficient staff.  In and out very quickly.

name: Voodoo Actual
text: Great staff! They are both caring and efficient.

name: Ella Hood
text: It runs like a machine. Perfect in every way

name: Aja Miller
text: Unprofessional and unorganized. I came in for my appointment on March 9, and I was told that my appointment was scheduled for the next day. Which is ridiculous because I know I was told that my appointment was on March 9 because that’s my birthday. I come in the next day for my appointment, and I am told this time that my appointment was yesterday. The receptionist tells me, “Oh, she must have gotten you confused with someone else.” Like what? Save yourself the time and headache and go somewhere else because obviously they lack professionalism, organization, and communication skills.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We'd like the chance to look into the situation you have described. Could you please reach out to us at 205-930-2333 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm)? We look forward to hearing from you. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

This has been at least 3 weeks ago - my place of employment still has not received the paperwork needed for me to do my job, and I can’t reach anyone by telephone to follow up on my results.

name: Nicki Conlon
text: You need to look at the reviews before you ever go to this sorry excuse for a company! Completely miserable people working at this place and their intent is to project that on to anyone there! Save yourself and your company a miserable experience and go to a better company!!!l The manger of this place should actually be fired for allowing his or her employees to act in such an unprofessional manor!!!

text: The lady at the desk had a slight attitude however everyone in the back was professional and efficient. text: Dr. Michael Cloyd is the rudest doctor I have ever encountered. His horrible bedside manner is honestly astounding. I would recommended going anywhere else in the area rather than being his patient.

name: Tara Moore-Crumpton
text: Rude incompetent and awful staff. Did not want to take the time to listen, and even had my company call to explain things to them, but they didn’t care, all they wanted was to do the easy way. Will not come back to this place unless I want to die.

name: Steven Lord
text: This place is horrible, long waits, people are becoming impatient. I have never waited this long for a drug test in 21 years of working. Be prepared to wait!

name: Danielle LaBombarde
text: Rude front desk staff! Still sitting in the waiting area after 2 hours! Several people have rescheduled appointments because they have been waiting so long. Should I have to come back, I would rather drive an hour out of my way to go somewhere else! Avoid coming here if possible!!!

text: If could give -5 I would, and the receptionist so rude, wouldn't recommend this place at all.been here once a week 4 làst 4 weeks receptionist needs a lot of training in patient communication she is horrible.

text: Terrible service, took 5 hours for me to have a drug testing and screening done, should’ve checked reviews beforehand.

name: Kristin Sims
text: Today we had an appointment for an Ultrasound. Our ultrasound technician (Ashlynn) was amazing! She was kind, patient, friendly, professional, and efficient! We appreciated her hard work and kindness in getting the scan completed in a timely manner. She told us without asking what the next steps were and we will be glad to use this facility in the future! We also appreciated the sign on the door which read “Masks are welcome”. With this option people can make choices to wear them if they’d like but aren’t forced to mask. This is true freedom. I appreciate that!

resp.text:
Kristin, thank you for the kind words. I will be sure that Ashlynn is told of your review. It is our pleasure to care for your needs and appreciate the opportunity to be of service to  you. We are happy that you chose us for your imaging procedure and hope that you are feeling better soon.

Regards,
Bart Medlen
Owner

name: Deborah Baker
text: Terrible experience. Was referred here by UAB Oncologist. Had 5:30 appointment. At 7:25 still have not been seen!!!!

name: Tim Suttles
text: Only 3 people in the office when I showed up for my xray....got out over 1.5 hours later! The xray f was fast. No one seems to care they make you wait with no update or reason.

name: Danny McMullins
text: Had 330 mri appointment. It's 4 and I'm still sitting here. Not that busy but went to desk and was told they are running behind

name: M&M
text: I came straight from my doctors office. The staff was amazing! They got me & out quickly. The tech was very nice. Would recommend.

name: Wendy McLellan
text: This place is a hot mess. Didn’t tell me I needed to be fasting for my test until I called and asked because someoneI know told me I needed to fast for this test.  Then were over an hour behind schedule for my 7 o’clock test time.  Lied and told me that my appointment was really at 7:30.   Never called to let me know they were so far behind which would have been the professional thing to do.  I have to take meds for anxiety to get into the MRI tube and now they are wearing off because I had to wait so long.  This place sucks.  Will never come back.

name: Russell Pierce
text: The lobby was open when I arrived at 6:48am.  I was able to fill out the relatively short patient information form and then waited about 10 min. to be seen.  I did not have an appointment.  The staff was courteous and fast.

name: Kimberly Nation Morton
text:
Me and my husband have both used them and very happy !
Best MRI experience .. fast too !
Their staff is so friendly and very very caring !
They go out of their way for you in every way !!!
And their radiologist are very good as well as their technicians , and the equipment is great to.
So nice to be greeted by smiling faces at the front desk and on the phone they were very accommodating even got us in a day earlier because of a cancellation!

resp.text:
Kimberly,

Thank you for the kind words. We appreciate the opportunity to serve you. We realize that you have multiple facilities available to choose from and are very happy that you chose us. We want everyone that walks through our doors to feel comfortable in a sometimes uncomfortable situation. It is our pleasure to serve you and if you need imaging services in the future please consider us again.

Bart Medlen

Owner

name: Tara Landrom
text: Don't go here to get a mammogram. Incompetent fill-ins. Had an abnormal reading for the first time when they had a lady who clearly didn't know what she was doing. I've had 10 mammograms here and one person can ruin your day. I had to go to another facility to another one. Praise God it was negative. I will never go to this place again. Go somewhere else with updated equipment.

name: Shonna Davis
text: We went to get a copy of an MRI yesterday to find they had closed at least 45 minutes early. I called a few hours before we left and was assured that I could come in person, before 7PM (the alleged closing time Monday through Friday). We drove for almost an hour and a half after work to get there before the next scheduled doctors appointment (in Birmingham). Will not use them again.

name: Leigh Cooper
text: Awesome staff, thoroughly enjoyed our visit to this office. My daughter had to have ultrasound, wish I could remember our technicians name, she was great, very friendly and enjoyable! We had to come back the next day for a CT scan and Greg Nance was our technician and he was a pure joy. Daughter loved their conversation. Girls at front desk were great too, all around great experience!

name: Robert Kemper
text: The quickest in-and-out for any CT scan I've had in a long time. Good place but be careful where you park. It's hard to back up on to a busy street.

name: Fidgets Sailing
text: I'd give them negative stars if I could do so.  I have an incredible amount of pain - and live 40 min out from where this center is in Huntsville.  So my appt was made on a Thurs for a Monday at 6:30 pm.  I get there and get told their machine overheated that morning (first thing after a weekend???) then the receptionist tells me they tried to call me several times - no they didn't - they didn't even call one time.  So I waited 4 days, drive 40 min each way and deal with someone lying to me. I'll go to the imagine place on Franklin - they were professional (not rude nor lie) and their equipment works.

name: ni ki
text: Was scheduled here for a MRI. The moment I walked in the front lobby was blown away how rude the receptionist by the name of Brooke was rude to the elderly woman that came in for questions. I refused to be serviced by any company who has staff that goes out of there way to be malice and unkind to their customers. Remember people kindness and love goes a long way. If you are in the position to serve people then do it to the best of your abilities. When you are easily frustrated and find yourself speaking rudely and rolling your eyes at the very people who help your business grow,  then do ALL of us a favor and FIND a NEW job! Unacceptable to treat people any kind of way!

name: Jana Terry
text:
My first experience with them was great.  I was in and out in a short amount of time--- no waiting at all.  The x-ray tech and the young lady who did the Doppler were very nice and both seemed very knowledgeable.  However my experience this week was horrible.  I notified them on Monday that I had just been told I needed an MRI. I  specifically requested they perform it because they were close to my office and I had a good experience the week earlier. I said I must get the MRI by midnight October 31 as my insurance changes.  I was told "no problem"  -lots of openings.  My physician faxed over the order and my physician had a confirmation that it was received.  I asked the imagine center if they would get a pre-certification for it and they said they would and that they would contact me to schedule. I heard nothing else on Monday. Nothing Tuesday.  Wednesday I called again.  They said they did not get the orders.  I called my physician again and they were re-sent.  My physicians office even the centered and verbally verified that they were received.  Still I heard nothing for the remainder of the day.  I found out later that they left a message on my home machine for me to call (never tried my cell --or my work number) .   I called again today and was told my orders were not specific enough and that a pre-certification was needed.   I attempted to tell them that I had asked that do it.  The office manager immediately came on the phone, was very rude and unprofessional. She preceded to tell me how I needed to call my physicians office and get them to call the center and get the specifics.  I re-enforced  kept saying that I really need to get this today.  Bottom line I did not get my MRI before my insurance changed.  A total lack of communication as one employee is leaving a message on my home phone to schedule and it will not be anything out of pocket while another employee is on the phone with me telling me it will be $1600 total.  They can't do the MRI today but would be happy to schedule me for another day at  $1600 out of pocket.   What would have been zero out of pocket for me will now be $1600.  Am I aggravated and disappointed? YES!  I called and asked that my orders be sent to me so "maybe" I could find an open all night MRI facility somewhere and get the MRI taken care of.  The office manager refused to fax the documents to me.  I was told that they could only fax them to another physician.
They were my records, a fax is HIPAA compliant but they still refused even after I offered to sign a release.  The office manager is incredibly rude and there does not seem to be communication from one employee to another.  I am very disappointed in them and will most likely never visit their facility again.

name: Karen Griffith
text: I am so grateful to have found this place for an MRI of my knee.  I was treated with the utmost professionalism, respect, care and courtesy today by EVERY ONE I came in contact with from the front desk to the person who made my appointment yesterday (Christie). To the technician, Ben.  Unlike the first place (Bio Imaging) I was referred to yesterday by my doctor. It was like night and day in the treatment and professional care with Center for Imaging Excellence.  I will and would recommend them to ANYONE who wants to be treated with professionalism and excellent care!

name: Greg Hulgan
text: don't use this place rude receptionist ,I was there 2 hours for a knee and hip mri old slow equipment,they only have 1 MRI machine so be prepared to wait,  TELL YOUR DR. to send you somewhere else

name: Kelly Haynes
text: I went for two MRI's with contrast last night. They were open late enough so I didn't have to miss any work. The ladies at the front desk were very kind, prompt, and thorough. The tech assigned to me was very sweet and made me feel very comfortable during the procedure. She explained everything she was doing, each step of the way. They provided headphones during the test, since they're so loud. They had a private room for changing and leaving my valuables, which my tech locked once we went for testing. Will definitely go here for any future testing.

name: Greg Hulgan
text: don't use this place rude receptionist ,I was there 2 hours for a knee and hip mri old slow equipment,they only have 1 MRI machine so be prepared to wait,  TELL YOUR DR. to send you somewhere else

name: Cindy Langford

Cindy, Thank you very much for your kind words and for trusting The Center of Imaging Excellence with your imaging needs. We value your business and are thankful that you had a good experience with us.

Owner

text: The manager is amazing! I was in extreme pain and she was able to fit me in the schedule earlier than my 5pm appointment. The staff was very friendly.

Stating I had another appt at 230. This is wrong.

name: Heather Hanson
text: rude and condescending staff!

name: charisa àt Hopewell Homestead
text: Had to make a second unnecessary trip because the staff didn't do their job right the first time

name: Jacob
text: Rude manager. Expensive.

name: Ann Myers
text: Greg and Brittany were great!

name: Missy Powell
text: Nice place with very fast, professional services. Hope they get enough referrals to stay in business in Prattville. Recommend you getting your Imaging services, including same day MRI, at this facility as you can usually choose where you want to go yourself! Utilize this place as we want to keep a place this nice in our "Preferred Community"!

name: Jonathan Eric Headley
text: Very nice facility. Easy to get to very nice and professional staff. Always easy to talk to and help in anyway possible. They try everyway to make you comfortable. I went in January 2018 for an MRI and I am about to have another one. I am requesting Sonos Imaging. They even have snacks and drinks for their patients. If I could give more stars I would.

name: Leslie Pettway
text: Really nice staff and the office and customer changing room was beautiful.

name: Victor Parker
text: It was ok. To me, the lady up front was the nicest of them all. Got my MRI done and they was helpful with that.

name: Sam Robinson
text: This company is very unethical! I went and had an MRI done paid my deductible and went on my way. I get a collection letter from Holloway Credit Solutions stating I owed an additional $75.00 above what the insurance paid and if I did not pay the $75.00, they would report me to the credit bureau. This was the first correspondence I had from Dothan Diagnostic Imaging regarding this debt.  I paid the $75.00 and contacted Blue Cross to ask them why they did not pay the $75.00. Blue Cross informed me they paid the bill in full and that I should not have paid the $75.00. This is a gimmick for Dothan Diagnostic Imaging to get more money for their services. Once I paid my deductible that was all I owed when they accepted payment from Blue Cross the bill was satisfied. I wonder how many other people they've exstorted money out of!

name: Angel Gallegos
text: I’m so disappointed I’m writing this review as I’m sitting here in their lobby, I was scheduled for my appointment last Friday, their machine was messed up so they called me 5 min before my appointment to cancel me, the lady said they would call later and reschedule for some day the following week, they never called I had to call the clinic to ask about it, the lady on the phone was rude, I finally was able to schedule my appointment, so I came in for my appointment which was a 3, the lady said be here 10 minutes before to fill out any forms, I showed up 20 min earlier, it is 3:50 and I’m just walking into my room for the appointment! So disappointed! The front desk guy was super nice, also the nurse who did my procedures was nice just the long time waiting.

name: Neil Martin
text:
I was scheduled for an MRI at my orthopedic's office and being that I had not met my deductible and I had an MRI at Dothan Diagnostic before I entered the information into my cost app and then followed up with a phone call to Dothan Diagnostic.  After speaking to a representative at Dothan Diagnostic I decided to have my doctor change the orders to this location.  Once I told the representative the price of the local orthopedic office she stated, "that would be our price if you didn't have any insurance"  Just so happens I got the bill and it was actually 30 to 40 percent more than I was quoted.  I called the office and the were no help.

I am the Complex Manager one if not the largest private employer in Dothan and will not use Dothan Diagnostic for any reason privately or personally.  I am amazed at their dishonestly.

name: Danimaito ._.
text: Y'all, when my women's doctor told me to go here for my mammogram, I thought she was maybe being a little extra, but I love my doctor and trust her, so I went along with it. Let me tell you, these people are awesome!  Every little detail, they treat you like an actual human being. You don't have to balance a clipboard on your lap to fill out paperwork, they have a table off to the side for that. You won't be changing into some flimsy paper gown, they have amazing, luxurious terry cloth lined robes. And, best of all, if you have time to wait (15 minutes) the doctor will read your mammogram right then and go over your results. Anything questionable, they can do additional testing right away. Such peace of mind, wonderful.

name: Suzanne McCreedy, Esq.
text: This was my first visit to Camellia Women's Imaging. What a great experience! Everyone was so nice, efficient, and answered my questions. Dr. Tataria is wonderful. The best part? You have your results before you leave. No waiting until someone calls you several days later. Thank you to everyone there.

name: Mary Saidla
text: This place is amazing. The staff is very friendly and makes you feel so at ease. We come from the western mountains of North Carolina annually to have my mammogram done. It is worth the long drive to be able to come, have a 3D mammogram and receive results while waiting for the radiologist to read the images. I was especially impressed with how seamless the process was even in the midst of Covid-19. They took extreme measures to protect their patients and themselves  I cannot say enough good things about this mammogram center. The bathrobes are an extra  cherry 🍒

name: Corey Hand
text: I had to go in due to a lump. Not only was the staff super quick and efficient, they seemed like they genuinely cared about my emotional state. I never felt uncomfortable, which is really something when you’re getting a mammogram. They were also super serious about COVID-19 protection. I would definitely recommend this staff and doctor. Amazing.

name: Mary Chunn
text: It had been several years since I had a mammogram and was a little nervous.  I found the doctor and the staff to be very professional and informative. They explained each step as it was taking place.  The entire process was much less stressful. I will definitely be returning.

name: amy ryan
text: I’ve been to one of the local hospital places before and it was fine but no personal feel. Here you have warm friendly staff, warm environment and most remarkable a Dr that comes in and sits with you to go over your results.  I also had an MRI one year at the hospital and she called me personally with those results. I’ve never had such service. Will def keep going to her.

name: Nekita Clark
text:
I've had mammograms before and it was very clinical and cold. Going in, I was afraid and I was in good company. We women all know someone who has been diagnosed with breast cancer (some very recently), and going into these testings is never easy.

I was greeted immediately with a kind front staff. Their energy was warm and affectionate. The nurses were pleasant. The process made me feel as if I'd joined a sisterhood. Dr. Tataria is warm and very informative. She made me feel active in my own healthcare and not bullied. I didn't feel like herded sheep or like another set of breast.

Leaving the office, I felt empowered regarding my health and every woman needs that. And did I mention you get results right after imaging? Or the state of the art equipment with 3D modeling? Those are pros too!

name: Margaret Davis
text: Great place, great people, great doctor!   Excellent!

name: Karen Kato
text: Absolutely fabulous.  Quick they view everything there right away.  Was in and out in an hour!   Docs and technicians were excellent and very professional.   Loved it!

name: Michelle Morgan
text: Absolutely the best experience I have ever had getting a mammogram! You meet with the radiologist the same day and the staff and facility were amazing. I will never go anywhere else.

name: Tabitha Corley
text: Amazing! First time having a mammogram. They were friendly, professional and really put me at ease. Super quick too!

name: Mary Waldman
text: I've been getting mammograms for many years at many facilities and Camellia is the best by far. The technicians are wonderful and work quickly. There are warm, fluffy robes to wear instead of those nasty hospital gowns. And having the results read and then explained to you afterwards is the cherry on the cake. Recommend very highly.

name: Christy Miller
text: Had my first experience of getting a mammogram done here a year ago. I was extremely nervous to say the least. The entire staff made me feel so comfortable and the actual mammogram itself was not as I expected. I am scheduled for my annual exam today and am not at ALL nervous. WONDERFUL PLACE AND AMAZING STAFF!!!!

name: Elizabeth Morrow
text: Although the staff and technician were very pleasant, the doctor was very condescending. I was told she would go over my risk factors however I got a lecture apparently because I didn’t have a wonderful experience at her facility.  My first mammogram and will be my last.

name: Leelee Gaissert
text:
Entire staff is friendly and compassionate.  In and out with same day results in about 1 hour.
Highly recommend!!!!!

name: Alabama Jenny
text: I felt welcome until the female Doc Tertaria came in. She was snippy, quick to cut me off when I spoke. I have had pain in one breast for a while. She couldn't see anything on imaging that I could feel. And while I am happy to know there was no mass, I felt as if she scolded me for feeling concerned. I won’t go back there. Ever!

resp.text: Dr. Tataria makes it her highest priority to ensure that all patients receive the highest level of personalized care and that patients feel cared for when receiving their same day results. If this did not happen, please call us at (205)-544-2828 so that we may address your concerns.

name: Brittney M
text: From start to finish Dr. Tataria and her staff made sure I was comfortable and knew exactly what being done. Follow up was great and I had my biopsy results in a very reasonable amount of time. The staff at the front desk welcomed me with smiles and the clinical staff had a very good bedside manner. I would definitely recommend Camellia Imaging.

name: Lindsay Harris
text: As opposed to a sterile environment where you're treated like a number, this place is warm and welcoming and you feel like a VIP! Robes, snacks, drinks, and no wait. They also put me at ease for a very nerve racking appointment.  The doctor met me right at the beginning,  attended the ultrasound and delivered the results immediately.  State of the art equipment just like the hospitals. The staff was super friendly.  Can't say enough good things!

name: joe and kathi dunnam
text: Love this place! Everyone is very friendly and professional. Michelle and Dr. Tataria had me in and out in no time with my results before walking out the door. And, they are equipped with the newest and best equipment available.

name: Alina Efremova
text: Amazing Medical office . Nice , kind and very friendly stuff . Thank you so much for this unbelievable experience. I recommend everyone to come visit this facility . You guys are awesome!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words Alina. We are so glad we were able to meet you!!

name: Trudy Johnson
text: Caring, comprehensive patient care. So unique to have the doctor share your results with you before you leave. The best of the best!

name: April Rogers
text: This was the BEST experience I have EVER had with a mammogram.  Fast, immediate results and super friendly staff.

name: tywanna maye
text: They were very caring and professional. Dr Tataria(sp) covered everything and even scheduled my additional appointments

name: Beth E
text: It was the best experience.  The staff is caring and easy to talk to.  Dr Tataria is Awesome and I love that I didn't have to wait for results!

resp.text: Thanks for coming to Camellia Imaging, Beth!

name: Ellen Mixon
text: I have to recommend Camellia! I was treated like royalty. These sweet faces make the process so much better. Thank you, Carmellia!

name: Elizabeth Owings
text: After an abnormal mammogram, Dr. Tataria performed an ultrasound.  It wasn't completely normal, so she recommended a biopsy.  Dr. Tataria and the staff made me and my husband feel completely comfortable, and the biopsy took only a few minutes.  She called me personally the next day to tell me it was totally benign!  I highly recommend Camellia Women's Imaging.

name: Jill Pate
text: Good experience. You park right in front of the building and at the end of your appointment, meet with the physician on staff to review your results.  Professional and friendly staff.  Definitely recommend for 3D imaging mammogram.

name: Susan LeCroy
text: I must admit that I have put off having a baseline mammogram for almost 10 years.  I finally broke down and decided I really needed to go.  I am so thrilled that I chose Camellia Women's Imaging. It was a great experience from the time I signed in until the time I left.  Everyone was so friendly and caring.  I love the fact that Dr. Tataria reads your mammogram while you are there so you don't have to wait and wonder for days on end.  She goes over everything and answers any questions that you might have.  If she feels you need additional testing it can be done the same day as well.  I also love the fact that I made my appointment and they handled the rest.  I gave them my MD's information and they called and got the prescription and handled everything with my insurance.  I am so glad I found this place and I have been telling everyone about Dr. Tataria and her wonderful staff!!

name: Rashida Reese
text: 1st Mammogram with much anxiety. The entire staff eased my worry and was very thorough during my exam. Highly recommended.

resp.text: We are glad we were able to help ease your anxiety!

name: S. A.M.
text:
Mom and I had heard, through the grapevine, about Dr. Monika Tataria and her lovely establishment. Sadly, even though they had great things to say about Dr. M and her outstanding team, I simply didn’t feel like they were as gung-ho about how amazing the experience actually is......hence, the reason for my review of Camellia Women’s Imaging on Valleydale Road, in Hoover.
Before we had even arrived, as we made our appt. over the phone, the gals at the front desk, sent me over an email while we were on the phone in order for them to get my digital signature, so that they could have all of my images and reports, transferred digitally from Brookwood Hospital, which we also have never had issues with.
That was done instantly, and that was that.

Mom needed a diagnostic appt. due to the fact that they had seen something at Brookwood and wanted to do further imaging/ultrasounding. They didn’t have an immediate appointment, and I was already coming in to Camellia, so the team at CWI  got mom in, immediately, with me. Dr. M even sent somebody from her office over to Brookwood the morning of mom’s appt, because it was with such short notice, that we didn’t have time to compile everything. AND this all before we even walked in the front door!
Don’t let the exterior of the building fool you. Once you step into Camellia, you’ll feel so welcome and at ease, that you’ll have to keep reminding yourself that you’re there for imaging and not at the spa! Ha!
At the onset of our appt. BEFORE imaging, we were offered a beverage of our choice and we then sat down with Dr. M so that she could listen to our concerns. Such a pleasure to have a professional who is genuinely interested in us and our health. After Dr. M took all of the time necessary, we were then shown back to the dressing area where we were given the most luxurious and softest robes we’d ever had on! Ritz-Carlton and Four Seasons have nothing on these robes......no paper towel, opening at the back, degrading piece of paper around CWI.
Once changed, one by one, we were escorted to our imaging and ultrasounding.........ultrasounding performed by Dr. M, herself. Thorough, patient, kind and caring. Yes, ladies.....I’m talking about mammograms, here.....ha!
Listen ladies, we’ve been told that all mammograms are the same....well, they had been, until CWI came on the scene. This is not your same, run of the mill experience.
After imaging is finished, Dr. M then met with us, AGAIN......To go over her findings and any other concerns and questions that we may have had. Not to divulge private info, but mom’s mammo wasn’t 100%, but nothing dangerous. You would have thought that mom was Dr. M’s mom. She really handled her with extra TLC and mom was almost crying with relief after all was said and done. Not to say that we all don’t get the same enhanced and personalized attention, but mom’s older and Dr. M really knew exactly how to care for each of us as individuals.
A Forward-Thinking professional, such as Dr. M and her team players, make this world a better place. Mom and I are forever thankful, as our those who loves us, and is it crazy to say that we’re looking forward to our next appt??? Ha!!! Let’s put it this way........never again will we miss our appt’s, or make excuses for rescheduling or whatever. Every single woman  (and man) who wants to be treated with kindness and dignity, MUST only ever use Dr. Monika Tataria and her lovely, state of the art 3D imaging center. Her team supports her wholeheartedly, and they run a well oiled machine.
Thank you Dr. M......I sure hope our words have expressed how grateful we are for kind and caring professionals such as yourself. 😃

name: Delisa “Lisa” Chasteen
text: Love this place! Nice, friendly and very thorough!!!

name: Sandra Lewis
text: Everyone was very nice

name: MaMaG
text: The best place ever handsdown!!!!💜💜💜💜

resp.text: Thank you for coming to Camellia Imaging!!
